entries.name: Age
entries: Dōbutsu come of age in their teens and rarely exceed one century.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Being so closely aligned with the fey, dōbutsu take after them and their chaotic natures.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dōbutsu vary from below five feet to seven feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Beast Senses
entries: You are proficient in the Perception skill.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Natural Weapons
entries: Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write Common and Sylvan.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: You may choose the type of dōbutsu you will be. There are four types: Neko, Kitsune, Okami or Usagi.

The neko have similarities to domesticated cats. People usually think of them as being weaker than the other dōbutsu. They often go adventuring having a super high chance of leaving home because of the curiosity inside them. The neko have tails and ears that are more glossy and often lick them. The nekos of the past often were seen with wild cats that seemed to be close companions.

entries.name: Naturally Graceful
entries: Cats always land on their feet. You have resistance to fall damage.

entries.name: Elusive
entries: Opportunity attacks against you have disadvantage.

The kitsune get traits resembling a fox yokai. They are more like tricksters than the other dōbutsu and have a higher chance of becoming chaotic. Kitsune fur has a large amount of magic made into it giving the appearance of glowing. The kitsune often tricks humans into falling in love with it then taking them out.

entries.name: Fox Tails
entries: You have the tail of a fox and gain an additional tail every other level until you have 9 tails. You can use your tail as if it were a spellcasting focus.

entries.name: Fox Illusion
entries: You know the minor illusion cantrip. At 5th level, you can cast the alter self spell once, requiring no material components, and you regain the ability to cast it this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

The okami are the wolf of the dōbutsu world. They are super loyal and often are more lawful than chaotic. The okami fur is often wilder than the other subraces. In the past, they were the strongest warriors in the dōbutsu. They were as crazy as Norse berserkers but also had a strong scene of morals. They have mostly kept the same moral but some have twist law so that they may accomplish their goals.

entries.name: Keen Ears
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

entries.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

The Usagi have similarities to rabbits. People usually think of them as being weaker than the other dōbutsu. They often go adventuring having a super high chance of leaving home because of the curiosity inside them. The Usagi have tails and ears that are more glossy and often lick them. The Usagi of the past often were rarely seen unless to give aid to hurt or lost travelers.

entries.name: Nimble Climber
entries: Your limbs are strengthened by your animal aspect. You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Rabbit's Agility
entries: Your reflexes and agility allow you to move with a burst of speed. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the tum. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.

entries.name: Age
entries: Oni reach maturity about the same time as humans do, but their aging slows down drastically after that. Most live to about 1000 years old.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most oni are naturally evil. Their heightened sensitivity to the temptations of the Material Plane usually drives them to steal, fight and manipulate to get what they want.

entries.name: Size
entries: Oni are a sizeable people, reaching heights from 7 and 8 feet tall by maturity and weigh between 280 and 340 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: As a creature of the night, you are very good at seeing in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Yokai Resistance
entries: Thanks to the energy of the yokai, you have resistance to poison damage and advantage on saving throws against becoming poisoned.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Supernatural Strength
entries: You can wield a weapon with the versatile property in one hand, but use the damage dice as if you were wielding it in two hands. In addition, Half-Oni's add their proficiency bonus to damage when making an unarmed attack.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and write, Common and Giant.

The most common out of the oni, red oni or aka oni are known for their large size and toughness. They are slightly bigger than the rest of their kin, with skin coloration in shades of dark red. They are violent, hot-headed, and unfocused, often pursuing immediate satisfaction and disregarding long-term plots and schemes.

entries.name: The Revel Continues
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can’t use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

Blue oni or ao oni are known for their unnatural cunning and aptitude for magic. They are smaller than their red kin, though larger than their pale kin, and with skin coloration of shades of dark blue. They are usually calculating and meticulous pursuing lofty goals such as of power and knowledge.

entries.name: Oni Magic.
entries: Blue oni can muster the innate magic within themselves which gets stronger as they grow in power. You know the dancing lights cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the charm person spell once and need to finish a long rest before you can cast it again. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

Pale oni or shiro oni are known for their aloofness and connections to the spiritual realm. They are the smallest of oni, and are the fewest. Their skin can vary from pale white to light grey. Unlike the other oni, pale oni wish only to keep the balance between the Spirit World and the Material Plane. They usually guard locations where the presence of the Spirit World but sometimes adventure to seek artifacts of the spirit world or mend imbalances.

entries.name: Spirit Walk.
entries: You teleport when you take the dash action.
